H0.text: Compact bone makes up the dense outer layer of bones.

H1.text: Adipose tissue makes up the dense outer layer of bones.

H2.text: Ligaments make up the dense outer layer of bones.

H3.text: Plasma is what makes up the dense outer layer of bones.

A4.text: The hard outer layer of bones is composed of cortical bone, which is also called compact bone as it is much denser than cancellous bone.

A5.text: Cancellous bone has a higher surface-area-to-volume ratio than cortical bone and it is less dense.
